document_data.name: Of Fathers, Faiths, and Fortunes
document_data.author: [[Aleena Paladinstar]]
document_data.mainbody: '''''Of Fathers, Faiths, and Fortunes''''' was a [[book]] of musings written by [[Aleena Paladinstar]], daughter of [[Open Lord]] [[Piergeiron Paladinson]] of [[Waterdeep]], and published in the early 15{{th}} century [[DR]]. {{quote|For Waterdeep to remain the City of Splendors, it needs heroes and folk of valor to carry her banners higher than commerce or politics. Splendor is not a right but a privilege, and one that must be earned by courage, not bought by coin nor conjured by magic.|An excerpt from ''Of Fathers, Faiths, and Fortunes''}}
document_data.History: Aleena and her husband [[Savengriff]] became prolific writers. One of the books from under their [[quill]]s was ''Of Fathers, Faiths, and Fortunes'', published in the {{YearlinkName|1403}}. In the {{YearlinkName|1479}}, [[Renaer Neverember]] owned the couple's entire body of mundane works, which included Aleena's ''Of Fathers, Faiths, and Fortunes''.
